data.title: carl gottlieb — Blog — The Daily Jaws
data.meta_description: Get your city hands on Jaws and shark film retrospectives, in depth articles, film reviews, interviews and product reviews. We give you the head, the tail, the whole damn thing!
data.text:
From Jerks to JAWS and beyond: The genius of screenwriter Carl Gottlieb

Carl Gottlieb is an American legend in screenwriting, acting, comedy, and executive roles. He rose to fame for co-writing the screenplay for the iconic film Jaws (1975) and its first two sequels. He also directed the 1981 film Caveman.

Read More

Cabin Fever: How local log cabin helped Steven Spielberg forge shark classic Jaws

Where did Steven Spielberg live when he was filming Jaws? He shared a cabin with Carl Gottlieb, with Robert Shaw, Roy Scheider and Richard Dreyfuss all frequent visitors to help get the script right, creating the shark classic we know and love today.

Read More
